intro: Tetracera sarmentosa subsp. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran tetracera, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
